page.title: 14INNS AND PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content: The Bear Inn Hotel is a remarkable black and white half-timbered house, dating back to the 16th Century. It stands opposite the Hundred House at the junction of the A53 and A442. The Landlord and Landlady of the Inn are Mr.Brian McCarthy and his wife Catherine. Inside, a warm welcome is felt from the log fires and there is free top- class entertainment. Medieval Banquets are held in the upstairs banqueting hall. This will hold 80 people and is also used for Birthday Parties and Weddings. Good food is always served there and on sunny days, tables and chairs are provided for outdoor drinks. There is a large carpark at the rear. There is a story that a secret tunnel links the Hotel with St.Luke's Church. A.A.B.
